title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.39 | 29-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session, we will be discussing from the 39th verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam that will be discussed.

segments.key_quote: The simple and delicate women truly thought that Lord Sri Krishna, their beloved husband, followed them and was dominated by them.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the verse, highlighting the simplicity of Krishna's queens who were unaware of His full glories, and emphasizes that Krishna reciprocates with devotees due to their unconditional devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Even the transcendental wives of Lord Sri Krishna did not know completely the unfathomable glories of the Lord because his glories are unlimited.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Lord Ananta Sesha to illustrate the unlimited nature of Krishna's glories, which are beyond comprehension even for great beings.

segments.key_quote: It's because in such a case of the pure devotees, there is the action of the internal potency of the Lord, the spiritual potency, the internal potency, Yogamaya.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the apparent ignorance of devotees about Krishna's full glories is due to Yogamaya, which facilitates the exchange of transcendental relationships, using the example of Arjuna ordering Krishna as his chariot driver.

segments.key_quote: Simply for the sake of pleasure the Lord reciprocates.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna's supreme position is unaffected by His roles in pastimes, and that the Lord and His devotees engage in pleasure pastimes driven by mutual love and a desire to please each other.

segments.key_quote: The Lord, when he comes down, he wants to give us a sample.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna descends to the material world with His associates to give a glimpse of the spiritual world and attract conditioned souls, emphasizing the need for purification through bhakti to join Krishna's pastimes.

segments.key_quote: In the spiritual world, or in contact with Krishna, in devotional service, there is always transcendental bliss.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the dry, unsatisfying nature of material existence with the transcendental bliss of devotional service, urging listeners to understand this difference through the descriptions in the Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: They are perfect representations of the marginal or internal potency in complete negation of the influence of the external potency.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna's associates who descend with Him are liberated souls with pure Krishna consciousness, untouched by material contamination, unlike conditioned souls who desire to lord over material nature.

segments.key_quote: The wives of lord Krishna were made to forget the immeasurable glories of the lord by the internal potency, so that there might not be any flaw of exchange.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that pure devotees don't seek material enjoyment because they experience spiritual bliss, and that Yogamaya allows Krishna's queens to forget His greatness, enabling a free and loving exchange of feelings, concluding with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
